page.title: 07GOATS AT WILBARSTON
page.content: In Wilbarston there is a small home business started four years ago by Mrs. Lesley Hammock.She breeds goats and sells their products.The milk is popular with children with allergies such as asthma.She also makes cheese and yoghurt.The kids are killed for meat at six months.There are two herds consisting of 20 Anglo Nebian goats,and a rare breed of Golden Guernsey.Trade has grown through word of mouth and advertising outside her home. Goat farming is not recognised by the Ministry of Agriculture,and therefore there is no Government help or concessional vets fees.Mrs Hammock is campaigning to find out the number of goat keepers in the country to try to attain recognition as farmers.
